verses.roman:
tatheti giriśādiṣṭo
mayaḥ para-puraṁ-jayaḥ
puraṁ nirmāya śālvāya
prādāt saubham ayas-mayam

synonyms: tathā—so be it; iti—having thus said; giri-śa—by Lord Śiva; ādiṣṭaḥ—ordered; mayaḥ—Maya Dānava; para—of the enemy; puram—the cities; jayaḥ—who conquers; puram—a city; nirmāya—constructing; śālvāya—to Śālva; prādāt—he gave; saubham—named Saubha; ayaḥ—of iron; mayam—made.
translation: Lord Śiva said, "So be it." On his order, Maya Dānava, who conquers his enemies' cities, constructed a flying iron city named Saubha and presented it to Śālva.
